subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ... True. ... I agree with that. ... If the meaning is identical and the glyph only slightly different, we can unify.  If the meaning is *completely*
messageBody:
amd64_hacker scripsit:

> If we work purely on the appearance we lose the phonic information and a
> lot of ease of use.

True.

> We can consolidate Shavian and Quikscript characters which are identical

I agree with that.

> but we shouldn't throw away all that extra information/functionality for
> the sake of a few code points.

If the meaning is identical and the glyph only slightly different,
we can unify. If the meaning is *completely* different, unification
is questionable.

I really need a side-by-side table before I can make rational judgments.

--
In politics, obedience and support John Cowan <cowan@...>
are the same thing. --Hannah Arendt http://www.ccil.org/~cowan

I agree with that.
